Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label two different types of habitats, one land-based and one water-based (e.g., forest and pond).
The student can draw and label several types of plants unique to each habitat (e.g., trees and grasses for the land habitat, aquatic plants for the water habitat).
The student can draw and label several types of animals unique to each habitat (e.g., ants and squirrels for the land habitat, fish and clams for the water habitat).
The student can draw comparisons in their illustration, showing how the types of living things differ between the two habitats.
The student can provide evidence of patterns by consistently grouping similar plants and animals within each habitat.
